titleStmt.title: R. F. Baird et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4602

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned citizens of Louisvile would most respectfully request His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky to pardon William R. Banks convicted of receiving stolen goods at the late term of the Jefferson Circuit Court. Mr. Banks has a wife & family of children, has served near three years in the Army of the U.S. and wishes to Reenlist in the Veteran Corps. His Excellency is refered to the facts of the case made out by his Attorney and duly authenticated. We hope the pardon will be extended --

R. F. Baird
J. H. Price
Jas C. Gill Coroner J. C.
Henry Wehmhott
C. Henry Pirck
John C. Baumberger
W. B. Casey
Patrick Carroll
Pacter Leonard
Thos Doolan
W R Hydes City Marshal
Carl Johnston
I. F. Wobbe Sr Dpt Clk City Ct
Joseph B. Read.
W. H. Monroe
Jon M Hehnke
L. A. Wood.
H C Russell Dpt marshal
